      • addActivityFromPattern

        public java.lang.String addActivityFromPattern(java.lang.String claimPublicID,
                                               java.lang.String activityPatternPublicId)
                                        throws com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException,
                                               PermissionException,
                                               EntityStateException,
                                               SOAPServerException
        Deprecated. Use the WS-I version of claim.ClaimAPI#createActivityFromPattern instead.
        Adds an activity to a claim using an activity pattern. First, attempts to generate an activity from the given pattern. The activity pattern must be from the list of activity patterns for the given claim that meet the following criteria:

        1) if the claim is closed, then the activity pattern must be available to closed claims 2) the activity pattern's loss type must either be null, or must match the claim's loss type.

        If the activity pattern doesn't match the above criteria, an EntityStateException is thrown.

        The new activity is initialized with the following fields from the activity pattern: Pattern, Type, Subject, Description, Mandatory, Priority, Recurring, Command

        The activity's target date is calculated using the pattern's targetStartPoint, TargetDays, TargetHours, and TargetIncludeDays fields. The activity's escalation date is calculated using the pattern's escalationStartPoint, EscalationDays, EscalationHours, and EscalationIncludeDays fields. If those fields aren't included in the activity pattern, then the target and/or escalation date won't be set. If the target date is calculated to be after the escalation date, then the target date is set to be the same as the escalation date.

        The acitivity's claim ID is set to the given claim ID, and the exposure ID is set to null. The activity's previousUserID is set to the current user.

        The newly created activity is then assigned to a group and/or user using the Assignment Engine. Finally, the activity is saved in the database, and the public id of the newly created activity is returned.

        Parameters:
        claimPublicID - The id of the claim that the activity should be added to
        activityPatternPublicId - The id of the activity pattern that is to be used for the activity
        Returns:
        The public id of the newly created activity
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException - if either the claimId or activityPatternId does not exist in the system
        PermissionException - if the caller does not have all of the following permissions: VIEW_CLAIM, CREATE_ACTIVITY
        EntityStateException - if there is an attempt to add an activity using an activity pattern that isn't available to the particular type of the given claim, or that isn't available to closed claim (if the given claim is closed)
        SOAPServerException

      • addActivityFromPatternWithOverride

        public java.lang.String addActivityFromPatternWithOverride(java.lang.String claimPublicID,
                                                           java.lang.String activityPatternPublicId,
                                                           FieldValue[] activityFields)
                                                    throws com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException,
                                                           PermissionException,
                                                           EntityStateException,
                                                           SOAPServerException
        Deprecated. Use the WS-I version of claim.ClaimAPI#createActivity instead.
        Adds an activity to a claim allowing for the specification of activity field values.
        Parameters:
        claimPublicID - The id of the claim to add the activity to
        activityPatternPublicId - The id of the activity pattern that is to be used for the activity
        activityFields - An array of field values that will be applied to the activity
        Returns:
        The String of the newly created activity
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException - if either the claimId or activityPatternId does not exist in the system
        PermissionException - if the caller does not have all of the following permissions: VIEW_CLAIM, CREATE_ACTIVITY
        EntityStateException - if there is an attempt to add an activity using an activity pattern that isn't available to the particular type of the given claim, or that isn't available to closed claim (if the given claim is closed)
        SOAPServerException

      • addClaimantActivityFromPattern

        public java.lang.String addClaimantActivityFromPattern(java.lang.String claimPublicID,
                                                       java.lang.String claimantPublicID,
                                                       java.lang.String activityPatternPublicId)
                                                throws com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException,
                                                       PermissionException,
                                                       EntityStateException,
                                                       SOAPServerException
        Deprecated. Use the WS-I version of claim.ClaimAPI#createActivity instead.
        Adds an activity to a claim using an activity pattern. First, attempts to generate an activity from the given pattern. The activity pattern must be from the list of activity patterns for the given claim that meet the following criteria:

        1) if the claim is closed, then the activity pattern must be available to closed claims
        2) the activity pattern's loss type must either be null, or must match the claim's loss type.

        If the activity pattern doesn't match the above criteria, an EntityStateException is thrown.

        The new activity is initialized with the following fields from the activity pattern: Pattern, Type, Subject, Description, Mandatory, Priority, Recurring, Command

        The activity's target date is calculated using the pattern's targetStartPoint, TargetDays, TargetHours, and TargetIncludeDays fields. The activity's escalation date is calculated using the pattern's escalationStartPoint, EscalationDays, EscalationHours, and EscalationIncludeDays fields. If those fields aren't included in the activity pattern, then the target and/or escalation date won't be set. If the target date is calculated to be after the escalation date, then the target date is set to be the same as the escalation date.

        The activity's claim ID is set to the given claim ID. The activity's previousUserID is set to the current user.

        The newly created activity is then assigned to a group and/or user using the Assignment Engine. Finally, the activity is saved in the database, and the public id of the newly created activity is returned. The activity is associated with the given claimant.

        Parameters:
        claimPublicID - The ID of the claim to which the activity should be added.
        claimantPublicID - The claimant (in the form of a public id of an existing contact record).
        activityPatternPublicId - The ID of the activity pattern that is to be used for the activity.
        Returns:
        The public id of the newly created activity.
        Throws:
        DataConversionException - if either the claimID or activityPatternID does not exist. If the contact isn't a claimant on the claim, throws DataConversionException.GeneralConversionException. If the contact isn't associated with the claim at all, throws DataConversionException.GeneralConversionException
        PermissionException - if the caller does not have all of the following permissions: VIEW_CLAIM, CREATE_ACTIVITY.
        EntityStateException - if there is an attempt to add an activity using an activity pattern that isn't available to the particular type of the given exposure, or that isn't available to a closed exposure (if the given exposure is closed).
        com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException
        SOAPServerException

        PermissionException
        EntityStateException
        SOAPServerException

      • migrateClaim

        public java.lang.String migrateClaim(Claim claim,
                                     ClaimState state,
                                     java.lang.String assignedGroupId,
                                     java.lang.String assignedUserId)
                              throws DataConversionException,
                                     PermissionException,
                                     EntityStateException,
                                     SOAPServerException
        Deprecated. Use the WS-I version of claim.ClaimAPI#migrateClaim instead.
        Adds a claim to the system. The claim must past level0 (loadsave) validation before it will be added to the system. The claim that is being added is presumed to have been worked on in another system and is being migrated to ClaimCenter, so it will not go through the load rules or the setup process that is executed by addFNOL(entity.Claim, boolean). The claim is marked as being in the given state.

        The steps executed by this method are

        1. Sets the claim state to the given state
        2. Assign the claim to the given user and group
        3. Validate the claim at the loadsave level
        4. Commit the claim; this will run pre-update rules, double check validation and run event rules

        WARNING: Do not add new claims to ClaimCenter via web service APIs while the financials calculations are running.

        Parameters:
        claim - The claim to be added to the system.
        state - The state of the claim - open, closed or draft. Must not be null
        assignedGroupId - Group to which the claim is assigned. Must be the public id of an existing group.
        assignedUserId - User that the claim will be assigned to. Must be the public id of an existing user and the user must belong to the group.
        Returns:
        The public id of the newly created claim.
        Throws:
        DataConversionException
        PermissionException
        EntityStateException
        SOAPServerException

      • migrateClaim

        public void migrateClaim(Claim claim,
                         ClaimState state,
                         java.lang.String assignedGroupId,
                         java.lang.String assignedUserId,
                         boolean commitChange)
                  throws DataConversionException,
                         PermissionException,
                         EntityStateException,
                         SOAPServerException
        Adds a claim to the system. The claim must past level0 (loadsave) validation before it will be added to the system. The claim that is being added is presumed to have been worked on in another system and is being migrated to ClaimCenter, so it will not go through the load rules or the setup process that is executed by addFNOL(entity.Claim, boolean). The claim is marked as being in the given state.

        The steps executed by this method are

        1. Sets the claim state to the given state
        2. Assign the claim to the given user and group
        3. Validate the claim at the loadsave level

        WARNING: Do not add new claims to ClaimCenter via web service APIs while the financials calculations are running.

        Parameters:
        claim - The claim to be added to the system.
        state - The state of the claim - open, closed or draft. Must not be null
        assignedGroupId - Group to which the claim is assigned. Must be the public id of an existing group.
        assignedUserId - User that the claim will be assigned to. Must be the public id of an existing user and the user must belong to the group.
        commitChange - if true, commits the change to the database, if false the caller is expected to manage the transaction
        Throws:
        DataConversionException
        PermissionException
        EntityStateException
        SOAPServerException

      • addCustomHistory

        public void addCustomHistory(java.lang.String claimPublicID,
                             CustomHistoryType historyType)
                      throws com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException,
                             PermissionException,
                             SOAPServerException,
                             EntityStateException
        Deprecated. Use the WS-I version of claim.ClaimAPI#createCustomHistory instead.
        Adds a custom history event to the a claim with the given CustomHistoryType, and a blank description
        Parameters:
        claimPublicID - The id of the claim to add to
        historyType - A String specifying the one of the elements in the custom history typelist.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException - If the String doesn't correspond to an existing claim, throws DataConversionException.BadIdentifierException.

      • addExposure

        public java.lang.String addExposure(java.lang.String claimPublicID,
                                    Exposure exposure)
                             throws com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException,
                                    PermissionException,
                                    EntityStateException,
                                    SOAPServerException,
                                    RequiredFieldException
        Deprecated. Use the WS-I version of claim.ClaimAPI#createExposure instead.
        Associates the given Exposure with a claim. If the claim's state is OPEN, then runs save and setup on the new exposure. If the claim's state is DRAFT, simply sets the exposure order on the claim.

        WARNING: Do not add new exposures to ClaimCenter via web service APIs while the financials calculations are running.

        saveAndSetup performs the following steps:

        1. Set the exposure's claim order
        2. Runs the "Pre-assign" ruleset on the exposure
        3. Runs the segmentation engine on the exposure
        4. Runs the strategy engine on the exposure
        5. Runs the assignment engine on the exposure
        6. Runs the workplan engine on the exposure
        7. Runs the "Post-assign" ruleset on the exposure
        8. Sets the exposure's status to "open"
        9. Create initial reserves
        10. Commits the exposures's bundle (which will contain the exposure, activities, and other objects creating during the call)
        Parameters:
        claimPublicID - The id of the claim to add the exposure to
        exposure - The Exposure to associate with the claim
        Returns:
        An String containing the identifier of the newly created exposure.
        Throws:
        com.guidewire.pl.system.webservices.XMLDataConversionException - If the String doesn't correspond to an existing claim, throws DataConversionException.BadIdentifierException.
        PermissionException - If the caller does not have both the EDIT_CLAIM permission and the CREATE_NEW_EXPOSURE permission.
        EntityStateException - if the claim has been marked closed or closed pending approval
        SOAPServerException
        RequiredFieldException

      • bulkValidate

        public ProcessID bulkValidate(long loadCommandID)
                       throws SOAPException
        Deprecated. Use startClaimValidation(java.lang.String) instead.
        Schedules all imported claims whose loadCommandID matches the supplied value for validation. The claim and its associated policy and exposures will be validated. Bulk validation uses distributed work queues to spread the work of validating large numbers of claims across multiple threads/nodes. This method does NOT perform the validation; instead, it creates a workitem for each claim to be validated. These workitems are processed by distributed worker instances that perform the validation.

        This method launches a batch process to generate the workitems; the process is NOT guaranteed (or expected) to finish before the method returns. The returned ProcessID can be used to query the status of the batch process using the methods on MaintenanceToolsAPI.

        By default no worker instances are configured to run for this process. In order to perform the actual validation, use MaintenanceToolsAPI.setWorkQueueConfig() to dynamically allocate worker instances.

        Parameters:
        loadCommandID - An integer value identifying the conversion batch that imported these claims.
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • startClaimValidation

        public ProcessID startClaimValidation(java.lang.String loadCommandPublicID)
                               throws SOAPException
        Schedules validation of the claim and associated policy and exposures for all claims whose LoadCommand has the supplied PublicID. This validation uses distributed work queues to spread the work across multiple threads/nodes. This method does NOT perform the validation itself, but rather launches a batch process that will create work items for each claim to be validated. These work items are processed by distributed worker instances that perform the validation.

        This method launches a batch process to generate the workitems; the process is NOT guaranteed (or expected) to finish before the method returns. The returned ProcessID can be used to query the status of the batch process using gw.webservice.cc.MaintenanceToolsAPI#batchProcessStatusByID().

        By default no worker instances are configured to run for this process. In order to perform the actual validation, use MaintenanceToolsAPI.setWorkQueueConfig() to dynamically allocate worker instances.

        The usual steps for using this method are:

        1. Load claims via TableImportAPI.integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAndLoadSourceTables())
        2. Extract the LoadCommand's PublicID from the returned TableImportResult object
        3. Call ClaimAPI.startClaimValidation(loadCommandPublicID)
        4. Poll MaintenanceToolsAPI.batchProcessStatusByID() using the returned processID until the batch process completes.
        5. Configure workers using MaintenanceToolsAPI.setWorkQueueConfig("ClaimValidation", new WorkQueueConfig())
        6. Notify workers using MaintenanceToolsAPI.notifyQueueWorkers("ClaimValidation")
        Parameters:
        loadCommandPublicID - A String value identifying the conversion batch that imported these claims. The loadCommandPublicID value is available through the TableImportResult object returned from a table import operation. (e.g. TableImportAPI.integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAndLoadSourceTables())
        Returns:
        the ID of the batch process
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • setPolicy

        public void setPolicy(Claim claim,
                      PolicySummary policySummary)
               throws DataConversionException,
                      PermissionException,
                      SOAPServerException,
                      EntityStateException
        Causes the policy on the Claim to be set to a new Policy instance found using the given information. If the specified policy is already set on the claim, then the policy information will be refreshed. This method does not commit the change. NOTE: Changing the policy can have many side effects, especially if the old and new policies do not contain the same set of sub-objects (such as vehicles). This method should be used with caution. NOTE2: The PolicySummary parameter should be populated with whatever information might be required to retrieve the appropriate Policy from the Policy adapter. It need not be as fully populated as it would be were it to be displayed in the UI. If policySummary.LossDate is null, sets that field to claim.LossDate.
        Parameters:
        claim - The claim whose policy will be set
        policySummary - a policy summary
        Throws:
        DataConversionException - If the public id doesn't correspond to an existing claim, throws DataConversionException.BadIdentifierException.
        PermissionException
        SOAPServerException
        EntityStateException - if the new policy's currency is different from the claim's original currency and the claim's currency cannot be updated

      • scheduleForArchive

        public java.lang.String scheduleForArchive(java.lang.String[] claimNumbers)
                                    throws SOAPException
        Schedules the claims with the given claim numbers for archive. The claims are looked up and, providing they are closed, are immediately scheduled for archive by creating a high priority work item that will be picked up by the archiving work queue. Note that the archiving work queue is processed asynchronously so it is unlikely that any of the claims will actually be archived by the time this call returns.

        There is a race condition that can affect this call. If a claim to be archived references a newly created admin object, such as a new user, there is a chance the archiving of the claim will fail because the new admin object has not yet been copied to the archiving database. This is a rare edge case as most claims to be archived are old, closed, claims which have not been altered for a long time. The chances of hitting this race condition can be minimized by explicitly running the archive batch process before calling this method, though this is expensive and is not recommended as a general practice.

        Parameters:
        claimNumbers - Claim numbers of the claims to schedule for archive
        Returns:
        a string containing the numbers of the claims that were scheduled for archive
        Throws:
        SOAPException - if claims cannot be scheduled for archive because they cannot be found, are closed or because an archive work item could not be created. If any of the claims is not found or is not closed then the call fails before attempting to archive any other claims. However if all the claims are present and closed it is possible, though very unlikely, for some work items to be created successfully and others to fail.

      • scheduleForArchiveByPublicId

        public java.lang.String scheduleForArchiveByPublicId(java.lang.String[] claimPublicIds)
                                              throws SOAPException
        Schedules the claims with the given public ids for archive. The claims are looked up and, providing they are closed, are immediately scheduled for archive by creating a high priority work item that will be picked up by the archiving work queue. Note that the archiving work queue is processed asynchronously so it is unlikely that any of the claims will actually be archived by the time this call returns.

        There is a race condition that can affect this call. If a claim to be archived references a newly created admin object, such as a new user, there is a chance the archiving of the claim will fail because the new admin object has not yet been copied to the archiving database. This is a rare edge case as most claims to be archived are old, closed, claims which have not been altered for a long time. The chances of hitting this race condition can be minimized by explicitly running the archive batch process before calling this method, though this is expensive and is not recommended as a general practice.

        Parameters:
        claimPublicIds - Public ids of the claims to schedule for archive
        Returns:
        a string containing the public ids of the claims that were scheduled for archive
        Throws:
        SOAPException - if claims cannot be scheduled for archive because they cannot be found, are closed or because an archive work item could not be created. If any of the claims is not found or is not closed then the call fails before attempting to archive any other claims. However if all the claims are present and closed it is possible, though very unlikely, for some work items to be created successfully and others to fail.

      • restoreClaim

        public java.lang.String[] restoreClaim(java.lang.String[] claimPublicIDs,
                                       java.lang.String comment)
        Retrieve claims from the archive database
        Parameters:
        claimPublicIDs - Public IDs of the claim to be retrieved
        comment - comment for restoring the claims
        Returns:
        The public IDs of the claims that were retrieved
